abstract: Madison, Wis, is experiencing surge in homeless people, issue that prompted Democratic Mayor Paul Soglin to pass legislation banning anyone from sleeping outside City Hall starting October 1; Soglin rests some of blame on state capital's liberal reputation.
lead_paragraph: A ban on sleeping outside City Hall at night reflects the city’s divided response to a problem that its mayor blames partly on its reputation for hospitality.

headline.main: Surge in Homelessness Tests Wisconsin Capital’s Welcoming Spirit
headline.print_headline: Surge in Homelessness Tests Wisconsin Capital’s Welcoming Spirit

snippet: A ban on sleeping outside City Hall at night reflects the city’s divided response to a problem that its mayor blames partly on its reputation for hospitality.
